LanguageData.IH_tickRateSingleTip: A seperate tick rate for when the game is running at 1x speed or auto slowdown mode. This allows much more frequent ticks without so much worry about performance
LanguageData.IH_tickRateTip: How often all immotals heal in game ticks. Default speed is 60 ticks per second so at the default of 250 an immortal would heal every 4ish seconds. Healing speeds are multiplied by the ticks passed so there should be no change to healing rate.
LanguageData.IH_tickRateRareTip: Roughly how many immortal ticks happen before a pawn will do things like attempt to regrow a limb or heal a scar.(Only uses base immortal tick rate, not 1x)
LanguageData.IH_disableFlashstormTip: Makes flashstorms that spawn from a beheaded immortal not start fires or do damage.
LanguageData.IH_firstDeathGrantsQuickeningTip: Enables/Disables if you can gain immortality from a pawn who hasent had their first death.
LanguageData.IH_ShowImmortalNumbersTip: Reveals the specific healing factor for immortal pawns
LanguageData.IH_DeathEffectOnValTip: A pawns immortality value will change by this number whenever they die.
LanguageData.IH_baseHealSpeedTip: Adjusts how fast a pawn will heal wounds and come back to life.
LanguageData.IH_scarHealSpeedTip: A multiplier for how fast scars heal. scars are only healed in rare ticks and at a much slower rate. At 1 a scar will heal about 1 severity per quadrum.
LanguageData.IH_immortalTransferBodyFactorTip: Determines how much the body size of a creature impacts the amount of immortality gained. 0 means no impact. 1 means 100%. The calculation is exponential so at 200% a creature with a body size of 2 will grant 4 times the immortality.
LanguageData.IH_immortalHealingBodyFactorTip: Determines how much the body size of a creature impacts the rate at which they heal. 0 mean no impact. 1 means 100% so a creature with a body size of 2 would heal twice as fast. At 200% the same creature would heal 4 times as fast
LanguageData.IH_regrowSpeedTip: The Speed at which a pawn will regrow limbs and organs
LanguageData.IH_regrowMaxPartsTip: Limits the number of activly regrowing parts to this number. Does not affect vital organs that start regrowing while a pawn is dead.
LanguageData.IH_regrowCostsNoFoodTip: Enables/Disables the acceleration of a pawns hunger while they are regenerating limbs and organs
LanguageData.IH_regrowCostsFoodTip: The food cost of regrowth is multiplied by this value
LanguageData.IH_accumulateFoodNeedTip: While pawns are regenerating and starving or dead they will gain a hediff that increases hunger. Spending time not starving reduces this.
LanguageData.IH_perStageHpTip: Adjusts the values of max part Hp per immortality stage, these values are added to the severity multiplier
LanguageData.IH_regrowLesserTip: Max base HP of a part a lesser immortal can regrow.
LanguageData.IH_regrowImmortalTip: Max base HP of a part an immortal can regrow.
LanguageData.IH_regrowGreaterTip: Max base HP of a part a greater immortal can regrow.
LanguageData.IH_regrowHighTip: Max base HP of a part a high immortal can regrow.
LanguageData.IH_regrowGrandTip: Max base HP of a part a grand immortal can regrow.
LanguageData.IH_regrowApexTip: Max base HP of a part an apex immortal can regrow.
LanguageData.IH_defaultAllTip: Shows several check boxes to select what sections to default
LanguageData.IH_defaultImmortalClassesTip: Removes all immortal classes and regenerates them using default values
LanguageData.IH_defaultDefaultImmortalTip: Reset the default immortality settings. As in the settings for things without an immortality class or any setting in an immortality class that uses default
LanguageData.IH_defaultRegrowthTip: Reset the per stage regrowth settings to default values.
LanguageData.IH_defaultGeneralTip: Reset general settings like tick rate and immortality numbers
LanguageData.IH_defaultQuickeningChangeTip: Resets the settings that govern how a pawn changes when they get a quickening.
LanguageData.IH_defaultTransferTip: Resets the settings that govern pawns gaining immortality from eating severed heads and stunted immortals
LanguageData.IH_removeImmortalityTip: Removes ALL immortality from EVERY pawn in the game, this cannot be reversed
LanguageData.IH_addImmortalityTip: Attempts to add immortality to every pawn both on the current map and in the world
LanguageData.IH_chanceTip: Hidden immortality or pre first death, in this state the pawn has no benefits of their immortality until they die.
LanguageData.IH_chanceVisibleTip: Visible immortality or post first death, an immortal in this state has full benefits from their immortality. This is the chance a hidden immortal will have their immortality increased to a value between the range below.
LanguageData.IH_ImmortalClassRangeTip: The minimum and maximum levels of immortality that a visible immortal will spawn with
LanguageData.IH_ImmortalClassTransferInTip: An extra multiplier for a pawn who is gaining immortality power from another. All incoming immortality from quickenings is multiplied by this number.
LanguageData.IH_ImmortalClassTransferOutTip: An extra multiplier for a pawn who is giving immortality power to another. All outgoing immortality from quickenings is multiplied by this number.
LanguageData.IH_learningMultTip: Skill experience is multiplied by this after it is calculated what to give to the reciever of a quickening
LanguageData.IH_passionChanceTip: The chance that a pawn will recieve a passion from a pawn during quickening. Each chance can increase a passion from none to minor or from minor to major.
LanguageData.IH_passionChancesTip: The number of times per quickening that a chance is rolled to gain a passion or increase a passion
LanguageData.IH_passionLossTip: The chance that a pawn will lose passions during a quickening.
LanguageData.IH_passionLimitTip: A hard limit on how many passions a pawn can have, minor passions count as 1 and majors count as 2. -1 to dissable
LanguageData.IH_categoriesTip: Opens the setings section that lets you change/add/remove immortality classes.
LanguageData.IH_NewClassTip: Creates a new immortality class which you can edit.
LanguageData.IH_DeleteClassTip: Removes an immorality class, this cannot be undone. To be sure you mean to do this you must slide the slider below all the way to the right
LanguageData.IH_slideConfirmTip: To confirm you want to delete this class slide this all the way to the right.
LanguageData.IH_ImmortalClassCanBeTip: Enables/Disables the pawns in this immortality class from being able to spawn as immortal
LanguageData.IH_ImmortalClassChanceTip: The chance a pawn will spawn with immortality. By default this immortality will be pre-first death but visible chance allows them to be higher tiers of immortals
LanguageData.IH_ImmortalClassChanceVisibleTip: The chance that a pawn who has generated as immortal will be given a higher tier of immortality between immortality range
LanguageData.IH_ImmortalClassPawnsTip: All the pawns in this list are in this immortality class
LanguageData.IH_ImmortalClassNonPawnsTip: All the pawns in this list are not in this immorality class. Red means they are not in any immorality class.
LanguageData.IH_ImmortalClassLoadMissing: Immortals count not find {0} pawn defs, these could be from removed mods. You may clear these old pawns from immortal classes in the immortal options menu, or you may leave them as they are harmless. These are the missing defs: {1}
LanguageData.IH_stealStage1Tip: Chance that a pawn will gain hidden immortality from eating the severed head from an immortal
LanguageData.IH_stealStage2Tip: >Chance that a pawn will gain hidden immortality from eating the severed head from a greater immortal
LanguageData.IH_stealStage3Tip: >Chance that a pawn will gain hidden immortality from eating the severed head from a high immortal
LanguageData.IH_stealStageTip: >Chance that a pawn will gain hidden immortality from eating the severed head from a grand immortal
>Chance that a pawn will gain hidden immortality from eating the severed head from an apex immortal
LanguageData.IH_stuntedChacneTip: The chance that a pawn who gains immortality will become a stunted immortal
LanguageData.IH_stuntedBurnChance: Chance a stunted immortal self burns
LanguageData.IH_stuntedBurnChanceTip: Every rare tick a stunted immortal will roll to see if it self burns. These burns cannot be healed by immortality but will reduce the level of the stunted hediff curing them sooner.
LanguageData.IH_stuntedBurnRate: The severity of the self burns
LanguageData.IH_stuntedBurnRateTip: A multiplier that effects the damage of the stunted burns.
LanguageData.IH_conditionMaxTip: The maximum progress conditions should get to, every immortal tick they will be set to this value if it is over this value. Conditions have a lethal severity of 1 and are non-tendable like bloodloss or malnutrition.
LanguageData.IH_diseaseMaxTip: The maximum progress diseases should get to, every immortal tick they will be set to this value if it is over this value. Diseases have a lethal severity of 1 and are tendable like infections of flu.
LanguageData.IH_hediffShowOnlyBadTip: Hides all hediffs that have isBad set to false
LanguageData.IH_hediffShowOnlyConditionTip: Hides all hediffs that do not have a lethal severity
LanguageData.IH_hediffShowOnlyCustomTip: Hides all hediffs that do not have custom settings.
LanguageData.IH_conditionTip: A condition hediff has a lethal severity of 1 and is non-tendable such as bloodloss or malnutrition.
LanguageData.IH_diseaseTip: A disesase hediff has a lethal severity of 1 and is tendable such as the flu or an infection.
LanguageData.IH_otherTip: Hediffs that don't fit into the other categories.
LanguageData.IH_hediffMaxProgressTip: The maximum progress this hediff should get to, every tick it will be set to this value if it is over this value.
LanguageData.IH_hediffHealSpeedTip: A multiplier for how fast this hediff heals. If set to 0 it will ignore this hediff
LanguageData.IH_hediffneedToCureTip: Does a pawn need to cure this hediff before it revives
LanguageData.IH_hediffCanGetTip: Should a pawn be able to get this hediff? This doesn't full stop a pawn from getting a hediff it just removes it when the immortality healing ticks
LanguageData.IH_hediffRegrowTip: Hediffs with this enabled will be *saved* to pawns every rare tick and when a hediff is missing that was there before it will be re-added.
LanguageData.IH_hediffLoadMissing: Immortals could not find {0} hediffs, it is possible they are from unloaded mods. You may clear these old hediff settings in the immortals options page, or leave them as they are harmless. These are the hediffs defs: {1}
LanguageData.IH_Designator_BeheadDesc: Cut off the head of a pawn or whatever may pass as a head for the pawn. This will stop any immortals from coming back to life.
LanguageData.IH_MustDesignateBeheadAble: Must designate pawn or creature who is dead or downed with a head.
LanguageData.IH_CanGetDiseaseTip: Will cure immortals of diseases if they contract them, a disease if any tendable fatal hediff.
LanguageData.IH_CanGetConditionsTip: Will cure immortals of any conditions, a condition is any non-tendable fatal hediff
LanguageData.IH_diseaseMaxProg: Stops the progress of a lethal disease at:
LanguageData.IH_diseaseMaxProgTip: Anything that is tendable with a lethal severity of 100% this includes things like infections and the flu. Set to 100% to disable
LanguageData.IH_conditionMaxProg: Stops the progress of a lethal condition at:
LanguageData.IH_conditionMaxProgTip: Anything that is not tendable with a lethal severity of 100% this includes things like bloodloss and heatstroke
LanguageData.IH_firstDeathHeal: Healing speed prior to first resurrection:
LanguageData.IH_firstDeathHealTip: The healing speed of an immortal after they have died their first death and before they have respawned. Changes how long they will be dead on their first death.
LanguageData.IH_maxPartSizeTip: Limits the maximum part Hp any immortal can regrow.
LanguageData.IH_maxPartStage: The maximum base part Hp added to calculate parts they can regrow when an immortal is at the {0} stage
LanguageData.IH_severityMaxPartTip: This value is multiplied by the severity of the immortal hediff. This value is then added to per stage values.
LanguageData.IH_severityCheckTip: Tool to see how specific severities would affect max part Hp
LanguageData.IH_editNoMaxTip: This condition will progress like normal
LanguageData.IH_editDisabled: This condition is disabled for immortals
LanguageData.IH_editCureDead: Have to cure this condition before revive
LanguageData.IH_editHealHediff: Should this condition heal over time
LanguageData.IH_Designator_ExtractorTriggerDesc: Use this immortal pawn to trigger a mortalis extractor.
LanguageData.IH_Designator_ImpaleDesc: Take a piece of steel and drive it through the heart of a pawn. This will stop an immortal from reviving.
LanguageData.IH_MustDesignateImpaleAble: Must designate downed or dead pawn.
